title: [BEAM-5098] Fix withoutDefaults and withFanout clearing side inputs
body:
Calling `withFanout` or `withFanout` on `Combine.Globally` would clear side input. This was due to those two functions using a constructor that did not accept side inputs. I have removed the offending constructor and rewritten the two functions to use the correct constructor.

I have also added a regression test in a separate commit. If it's too much for such a simple change, you can just merge commit with the fix.

title: [BEAM-5730] Migrate ITs using DataflowRunner to use custom worker
body:
Commit https://github.com/apache/beam/commit/e1b7a9be3a4a73460e1f4cdacf839638e2b2d889 migrated java dataflow runner ITs with legacy java worker to use custom worker jar. R: @herohde, @lukecwik 

Commit https://github.com/apache/beam/commit/3eba07962939486b83fbec67352e5cfc15c0e5ee changed the way setting up experiments. We shouldn't use Immutable list to set. R: @pabloem

makes it possible for these implementation details to not leak outside of the
Java SDK.

title: [BEAM-5442] Revert #6675 "Revert PRs #6557 #6589 #6600"
body:
Reverts apache/beam#6675

We are reverting #6675 because the intent of that change was to make sure we did not release with these new semantics.  Per our discussion on the mailing list, it seems that we are in agreement that we need better scoping for these runner options, which we will work on after this change.

title: [BEAM-5734] RedisIO: only call Jedis.exec() on finishBundle if there is something to send
body:
This fixes a bug in the RedisIO.write sink. The `finishBundle()` calls Jedis' `pipeline.exec()` method without checking if there is actually something to flush.

title: Use a unique path for staging non-PR changes instead of latest
body:
When the website is staged as part of a PR, it will use the PR number; outside of the PR context, it will derive a staging location based on the current user and branch name, i.e. `swegner-unique_staged`.

Local test: https://gradle.com/s/nuaoihnps6q4k

title: [BEAM-5717] Use the PR context from the environment rather than Gradle properties
body:
The :stageWebsite task uses the pull-request context to choose where to
stage the website on GCS. The current context binding currently captures
the pull request of the Seed Job run which generated the Precommit,
rather than from the actual precommit job run itself.

This fix removes the PR Id from the Job DSL / Gradle integration, and
instead reads the value directly from the environment variable set by
Jenkins.

------------------------

Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.
 - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf).

It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it.

title: [BEAM-5719] Use gcs rsync and validate that a valid baseUrl is specified
body:
A bug in the Website_Stage_GCS job was causing the Jenkins job to wipe
out the top-level GCS bucket used to stage and serve the website from.
This ends up blocking all future runs of the job and takes manual effort
to recreate and configure the bucket.

This change ensures that a valid baseUrl is provided before running
gsutil commands, and uses rsync instead of gsutil rm && gsutil cp. This
is both safer and more efficient.

------------------------

Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.

title: [BEAM-5717] Only pass PR ID to Gradle if available
body:
Our Jenkins pre-commit jobs pass a githubPullRequestId property into to
Gradle invocation when invoked in the context of a pull-request. This
allows PR-specific functionality, such as staging the website at a GCS
sub-directory based on the PR number.

Currently the Jenkins jobs is setting this parameter regardless of
whether there is actually a PR ID available, passing in garbage when
there is no associated PR. As a result, downstream Gradle tasks were
trying to use this garbage and failing.

This change only passes the githubPullRequestId parameter if there is
indeed an associated PR.

------------------------

Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.
 - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf).

It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it.

title: [BEAM-5713] Make ImpulseSourceFunction execute in parallel
body:
SourceFunctions only get deployed in a single task slot. Consequently, Flink
schedules subsequent tasks in task slots on the same TaskManager (if
available). This makes the source parallel which creates multiple instances of
the source. This helps to spread the tasks across all TaskManagers.

title: [BEAM-5714] Fix RedisIO EXEC without MULTI error
body:
## Problem

RedisIO has EXEC without MULTI error after set a batch of records.

After investigate the source code, I guess there is missing `pipeline.multi();` after exec() the last batch.

https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/sdks/java/io/redis/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/redis/RedisIO.java#L555

I have simulated the flow in `redis-cli`
```
redis:6379> multi
OK
redis:6379> set foo 1
QUEUED
redis:6379> set bar 2
QUEUED
redis:6379> exec
1) OK
2) OK
redis:6379> exec
(error) ERR EXEC without MULTI
redis:6379> multi
OK
redis:6379> set foo 2
QUEUED
redis:6379> set bar 2
QUEUED
redis:6379> exec
1) OK
2) OK
redis:6379>
```

## Solution 

- re-initiate the MULTI after EXEC a batch

------------------------

Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.
 - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf).

It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it.

@jbonofre @kennknowles

title: [BEAM-5623] Skip tests that halt test suite execution on Python 3
body:
Several tests in Beam fail to pass on Python 3, and also prevent tox test suite from making progress. This PR disables such tests. We recently started to use RUN_SKIPPED_PY3_TESTS variable to force skipped tests to be included into a Python 3 test suite, however since the tests excluded in this PR interrupt test suite execution, they will not be included even if we set RUN_SKIPPED_PY3_TESTS=1. Luckily, there are only a few of such tests.

title: [BEAM-5669] Ensure website publish doesn't create empty commits
body:
When checking if there are any changes to commit, only look at staged
changes. The default behavior of status.isClean() will return false if
there are staged or unstaged changes. There can be unstaged changes if
build side-effects produce extra artifacts in another directory.

Another solution would be to ignore other directories in .gitignore,
but if miss any new generated files we will once again produce empty
commits.

------------------------

Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.

title: [BEAM-5707] Add a periodic, streaming impulse source for Flink portable pipelines
body:
This is a rough attempt at addressing BEAM-5707. This is something we've found very useful internally for validating streaming functionality in the python SDK without needing a real streaming source like kafka or kinesis.

I'm still pretty new to beam, so wanted to get feedback early (before cleaning things up, writing docs, tests, etc).

A few questions up front:
* Should something like this have a standard beam URN? Currently I'm using `flink:transform:streaming_impulse:v1`.
* How should configuration be serialized between the python pipeline and the flink translation code? I've used JSON here; should it be protobuf or something else?

title: [BEAM-3925] [DO NOT MERGE] KafkaIO : Value provider support for reader configuration.
body:
ValueProvider support for KafkaIO reader configuration (input topics & bootstrap servers).
[NOTE: This is not meant for merge into master yet]

This enables users to write Dataflow templates using KafkaIO.

The main funcational changes is that partition information for topics is fetched at runtime by each of the source splits just before reading. This is required since Kafka topic names and cluster configuration may not be available at graph construction time.

This implies that we cannot adjust number of splits based on number of Kafka partitions. In order to get around this limitation this lets users explicitly specify number of splits (`withNumSplits()`). We can handle this better if we can let some splits not to have any partitions assigned at runtime. We need to something like that to be able to merge this into master. 

For now, this PR will serve as good starting point for developing templates with KafkaIO.
[cc: @azurezyq, @pupamanyu]

12:02:41 Email was triggered for: Failure - 1st

title: [BEAM-5687] Fix checkpointing of FlinkRunner for portable pipelines
body:
###  [BEAM-5687] Fix checkpointing of FlinkRunner for portable pipelines

This provides the input WindowValue Coder to ExecutableStageDoFnOperator which
ensures that the buffered elements can be checkpointed correctly.

### [BEAM-3727] Do not shutdown Impulse sources to enable checkpointing

Flink's checkpointing won't work properly after sources have finished. They need
to be up and running for as long as checkpoints should be taken. This was
already the case for the non-portable UnboundedSourceWrapper but it needs to be
extended also for Impulse transforms. 

### [BEAM-3727] Allow sources to shutdown when checkpointing is disabled 


CC @tweise @angoenka

title: [BEAM-5624] Fix avro.schema parser for py3
body:
Fix for the following error mentioned in BEAM-5624:
_AttributeError (module 'avro.schema' has no attribute 'parse')_

This is is part of a series of PRs with goal to make Apache Beam PY3 compatible. The proposal with the outlined approach has been documented [here](https://s.apache.org/beam-python-3).

@tvalentyn @Fematich @charlesccychen @aaltay @Juta @manuzhang

title: [BEAM-5681] Fix website tasks when pull-request ID is specified
body:
Website gradle tasks have special support for when running within the context of a PR, in order to stage files on GCS. However, adding this support broke the non-PR mode along the way.

Specifically, using a PR-based `baseUrl` would break the http-proofer internal URL checks, because it would expect to find resources at a /1234/ prefix path. The fix for this is to actually generate content in that prefixed location.

This PR makes all tasks consistent with how they expect and use baseurl paths.

------------------------

Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.
 - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf).

It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it.

title: [BEAM-5442] Store duplicate unknown options in a list argument
body:
As of BEAM-5442, we parse unknown pipeline options to pass them on to the actual
Runner. If the same unknown option appeared multiple times, it would be
registered a second time and throw an exception.

This change converts duplicate items to a value list.

title: [BEAM-5620] rename assertItemsEqual to assertCountEqual for PY3 compatibility
body:
Replaced all `assertItemsEqual` by assigning it to `assertCountEqual` on Python 2, as discussed in [BEAM-5620](https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=245&projectKey=BEAM&view=detail&selectedIssue=BEAM-5620)  and illustrated in https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/c34c367f5da6f9bef8a46471195470923a201af9/sdks/python/apache_beam/coders/coders_test_common.py#L61

I have added  `def setUpClass(cls)` if it wasn't available (only `setUp` was in most cases), so that it shouldn't be rerun for every test of the class.

This is is part of a series of PRs with goal to make Apache Beam PY3 compatible. The proposal with the outlined approach has been documented here: https://s.apache.org/beam-python-3

@tvalentyn @manuzhang @charlesccychen @aaltay @splovyt @Juta
